intro: Angelica uchiyamae, commonly known as Uchiyama's angelica, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
